newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Rugby union-Bentley try boosts Lions morale.
newsitem.headline: Rugby union-Bentley try boosts Lions morale.

text.p: Lions wing John Bentley was modest in victory after scoring the try of the tour against Gauteng Lions, but admitted his wonderful 70-metre dash had special significance for both himself and his team.

"I had a poor game against Northern Transvaal on Saturday and I'm a vocal guy so it was time for me to put up or shut up," said Bentley, who skipped past seven players to score in the 64th minute. "I'm glad to have helped put the tour back on the road."
Tour manager Fran Cotton called the match "a defining moment."

"It was an important win following Saturday's defeat and I thought our pack outscrummed Gauteng throughout. When we get the ball we do look good and I think we are capable of perfoming against any of the teams out here."

The only injury worry for the Lions was Tony Underwood, replaced on the hour with a shoulder and neck injury. Both have been strapped and Underwood will visit an orthopaedic surgeon for a check up on Thursday, but the initial prognosis is good.

Welsh centre Allan Bateman missed the match with a hamstring strain, but the management are hopeful he will be ready for Saturday's match against Natal in Durban. The squad will travel to Durban on Thursday afternoon.
